availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Thomas E. Coleman (Warren County, Kentucky, farmer and soldier)

body.p: Warren County, Kentucky, farmer and soldier. Warren County, Kentucky, native. Son of Catharine Coleman. Student in Warren County, Kentucky, in 1850. Farmer in Warren County in 1862. Mustered into the 33rd Kentucky Volunteer Infantry Regiment (U.S.A.) as private on September 13, 1862. Sentenced to death by G. C. M. on June 24, 1863. Discharged by order of President Abraham Lincoln.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Warren County, District 2, p. 88A.
Compiled Service Records of Volunteer Union Soldiers who Served in Organizations From the State of Kentucky, NARA RG 94, Microfilm Series M397, Roll 0494.
Report of the Adjutant General of the State of Kentucky, vol. 2, 1861-1866 (Frankfort: Kentucky Yeoman Office, 1867), 216-17.
"Thomas E. Coleman (1839-1919)," Find A Grave, Memorial #46487742, accessed January 15, 2022, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/46487742.
